00001 #ifndef _AMOP_ANY__HH
00002 #define _AMOP_ANY__HH
00003 
00004 #include <algorithm>
00005 #include <typeinfo>
00006 
00007 namespace amop
00008 {
00009 
00010 class any
00011 {
00012 public: // structors
00013         any() : content(0) {}
00014 
00015         template<typename ValueType>
00016                 any(const ValueType & value)
00017                 : content(new holder<ValueType>(value))
00018         {
00019         }
00020 
00021         any(const any & other)
00022                 : content(other.content ? other.content->clone() : 0)
00023         {
00024         }
00025 
00026         ~any()
00027         {
00028                 delete content;
00029         }
00030 
00031 public: // modifiers
00032 
00033         any & swap(any & rhs)
00034         {
00035                 std::swap(content, rhs.content);
00036                 return *this;
00037         }
00038 
00039         template<typename ValueType>
00040                 any & operator=(const ValueType & rhs)
00041         {
00042                 any(rhs).swap(*this);
00043                 return *this;
00044         }
00045 
00046         any & operator=(const any & rhs)
00047         {
00048                 any(rhs).swap(*this);
00049                 return *this;
00050         }
00051 
00052 public: // queries
00053 
00054         bool empty() const
00055         {
00056                 return !content;
00057         }
00058 
00059         const std::type_info & type() const
00060         {
00061                 return content ? content->type() : typeid(void);
00062         }
00063 
00064 private: // types
00065 
00066         class placeholder
00067         {
00068         public: // structors
00069 
00070                 virtual ~placeholder()
00071                 {
00072                 }
00073 
00074         public: // queries
00075 
00076                 virtual const std::type_info & type() const = 0;
00077 
00078                 virtual placeholder * clone() const = 0;
00079 
00080         };
00081 
00082         template<typename ValueType>
00083         class holder : public placeholder
00084         {
00085         public: // structors
00086 
00087                 holder(const ValueType & value)
00088                         : held(value)
00089                 {
00090                 }
00091 
00092         public: // queries
00093 
00094                 virtual const std::type_info & type() const
00095                 {
00096                         return typeid(ValueType);
00097                 }
00098 
00099                 virtual placeholder * clone() const
00100                 {
00101                         return new holder(held);
00102                 }
00103 
00104         public: // representation
00105 
00106                 ValueType held;
00107 
00108         };
00109 
00110 private: // representation
00111 
00112         template<typename ValueType>
00113                 friend ValueType * any_cast(any *);
00114 
00115         template<typename ValueType>
00116                 friend ValueType * unsafe_any_cast(any *);
00117 
00118         placeholder * content;
00119 
00120 };
00121 
00122 class bad_any_cast : public std::bad_cast
00123 {
00124 public:
00125         virtual const char * what() const throw()
00126         {
00127                 return "boost::bad_any_cast: "
00128                         "failed conversion using boost::any_cast";
00129         }
00130 };
00131 
00132 template<typename ValueType>
00133 ValueType * any_cast(any * operand)
00134 {
00135         return operand && operand->type() == typeid(ValueType)
00136                 ? &static_cast<any::holder<ValueType> *>(operand->content)->held
00137                 : 0;
00138 }
00139 
00140 template<typename ValueType>
00141 const ValueType * any_cast(const any * operand)
00142 {
00143         return any_cast<ValueType>(const_cast<any *>(operand));
00144 }
00145 
00146 template <class T>
00147 struct remove_reference
00148 {
00149         typedef T type;
00150 };
00151 
00152 template <class T>
00153 struct remove_reference<T&>
00154 {
00155         typedef T type;
00156 };
00157 
00158 template <class T>
00159 struct remove_reference<const T&>
00160 {
00161         typedef T type;
00162 };
00163 
00164 template<typename ValueType>
00165 ValueType any_cast(const any & operand)
00166 {
00167         typedef typename remove_reference<ValueType>::type nonref;
00168 
00169         const nonref * result = any_cast<nonref>(&operand);
00170         if(!result)
00171                 throw bad_any_cast();
00172         return *result;
00173 }
00174 
00175 template<typename ValueType>
00176 ValueType any_cast(any & operand)
00177 {
00178         typedef typename remove_reference<ValueType>::type nonref;
00179 
00180         nonref * result = any_cast<nonref>(&operand);
00181         if(!result)
00182                 throw bad_any_cast();
00183         return *result;
00184 }
00185 
00186 // Note: The "unsafe" versions of any_cast are not part of the
00187 // public interface and may be removed at any time. They are
00188 // required where we know what type is stored in the any and can't
00189 // use typeid() comparison, e.g., when our types may travel across
00190 // different shared libraries.
00191 template<typename ValueType>
00192 ValueType * unsafe_any_cast(any * operand)
00193 {
00194         return &static_cast<any::holder<ValueType> *>(operand->content)->held;
00195 }
00196 
00197 template<typename ValueType>
00198 const ValueType * unsafe_any_cast(const any * operand)
00199 {
00200         return any_cast<ValueType>(const_cast<any *>(operand));
00201 }
00202 
00203 }
00204 
00205 #endif //_AMOP_ANY__HH
